title: Third-place finisher in Paraguay’s presidential election arrested
description: Paraguayo Cubas Colomés was broadcasting on Facebook Live when he was detained for allegedly 'breaching the peace'.

title: US congresswoman introduces bill to restrict aid to Israel
description: The measure, backed by 17 Democrats, would ban US aid to Israel from contributing to detention of Palestinian children.

title: Colombia resumes ‘removal’ flights repatriating citizens from US
description: The announcement comes a day after Colombia announced a suspension of the flights, citing 'cruel' treatment.

title: Sudan army sends envoys for truce talks as fighting rages
description: Sudanese army sends delegation to Saudi Arabia for talks on humanitarian situation in the capital, Khartoum.

title: DeSantis signs bill allowing Florida board to cancel Disney deals
description: It ups a battle that started last year when Disney criticised a state law that banned LGBTQ instruction in schools.

title: What is the future for UN and aid organisations in Afghanistan?
description: The United Nations is assessing the future of its mission in Afghanistan after the Taliban banned women from working.

title: Messi apologises to PSG for unapproved Saudi Arabia trip
description: Paris Saint-Germain suspended the football player after he missed training.

title: HSBC quashes Ping An-backed protest vote at annual meeting
description: Ping An and individual investor had been pushing HSBC to consider a radical restructure of the bank & boost dividends.

title: UK to contribute to Brazil’s Amazon defence fund, PM Sunak says
description: Brazilian President Lula da Silva, who has promised to end Amazon deforestation, welcomes $101m pledge to Amazon Fund.

title: UK court jails Nigerian senator and wife for organ-harvest plot
description: Ike Ekweremadu sentenced to nine years and eight months and wife Beatrice sentenced to four years and six months.

title: Paraguay president-elect says will strengthen ties with Taiwan
description: Relations with the island loomed large in the election, after other countries in Latin America moved to cut ties.

title: US says it will not normalise relations with Syria’s Assad

title: Kenyan president sets up inquiry into religious cult deaths
description: The presidency announced the commission of inquiry on Friday even as cult leader Paul Mackenzie remained in custody.

title: At least 72 bodies recovered in flooded villages in east DR Congo
description: Torrential rain in South Kivu province causes river to overflow, washing away homes, leaving buildings encased in mud.

title: COVID no longer global health emergency, WHO says
description: UN health agency declares end to public health emergency of international concern, in place for more than three years.

title: ‘Crisis’: Calls grow to stem violence against Indigenous women
description: Advocates demand urgent action on day commemorating missing and murdered Indigenous women and girls in US and Canada.

description: Huwaida al-Hassan and her daughters are among the medical staff tending to pregnant women amid Sudan's clashes.

description: King Charles III will be crowned at Westminster Abbey on May 6. Here are five things you need to know.

title: S African opera singer excited to perform at Charles’ coronation
description: The South African is set to be the first African national to sing an opera solo at a British coronation ceremony.

title: Mali gov’t announces June 18 for referendum on new constitution
description: The military rulers previously missed a deadline to hold the referendum seen as a milestone towards elections next year.

title: Gardener, grandfather, king: Who is Charles III?
description: The UK is preparing to officially crown Charles and his wife Camilla on May 6 in a series of royal events.

title: Don’t use terrorism as diplomatic tool: Pakistan FM in India
description: Bhutto-Zardari is on a two-day visit to India for the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation meeting.

title: Prayer for rain, water rations: Catalonia struggles with drought
description: With no sign of rain clouds, the Catalan regional government broadens curbs on water use to 495 towns or villages.

title: ONE Championship takes the fight to the UFC with first US card
description: Singapore-based promotion plans event in Denver as it seeks to lay glove on leading rival on its own territory.

description: Singapore-based promotion set to hold event in Denver, Colorado, as it seeks to stake claim in US combat sports market.

title: Interim Burkina Faso president hails Russia as ‘strategic ally’
description: Ibrahim Traore speaks about conflict in Sahel, denies Russian mercenaries are helping his government fight rebels.

description: Following a week of fighting and looting, civilians are left with no access to drinking water, food and healthcare.

title: Kais Saied’s Tunisia is becoming a failed state
